title: RHA and UMPD form committee aimed at improving students’ relationship with police
author: The Diamondback

image.alt: University of Maryland Police headquarters in Pocomoke Building. (Elliot Scarangello / The Diamondback)

blurb:
In collaboration with the University of Maryland Police, the RHA launched a new committee this fall focusing on safety in dorms and around the campus.

The group, called the Residents and Police Committee, will work to strengthen the relationship between the Resident Hall Association and University Police and educate students on safety, said Hunter Marsh, the committee’s founder and head.

The committee plans to hold events in dorms with guest speakers and develop educational programs aimed at bringing students and police together for interactions in calm, non-confrontational settings.
